forkee.name: OpenTTD
forkee.description: OpenTTD is an open source simulation game based upon Transport Tycoon Deluxe

commits.message:
Update: Translations from eints
korean: 3 changes by telk5093
slovak: 1 change by legitalk
polish: 4 changes by pAter-exe
Change: Use modalpopup spacing for network relay and survey windows.
Change: Use modalpopup spacing for buy company window.
Change: Use modalpopup spacing for engine preview window.
Change: Use modalpopup spacing for goal question windows.
Codechange: Remove redundant WWT_PANEL from bootstrap error windows.

pull_request.title: Change: Use modal popup padding for consistency
pull_request.body:
## Motivation / Problem

Various modal popup style windows use magic numbers for their padding.

<!--
Describe here shortly
* For bug fixes:
    * What problem does this solve?
    * If there is already an issue, link the issue, otherwise describe the problem here.
* For features or gameplay changes:
    * What was the motivation to develop this feature?
    * Does this address any problem with the gameplay or interface?
    * Which group of players do you think would enjoy this feature?
-->


## Description

Use `modalpopup`, `vsep_wide` and `hsep_wide` WidgetDimensions instead. This brings consistency to these different windows.

<!--
Describe here shortly
* For bug fixes:
    * How is the problem solved?
* For features or gameplay changes:
    * What does this feature do?
    * How does it improve/solve the situation described under 'motivation'.
-->


## Limitations

<!--
Describe here
* Is the problem solved in all scenarios?
* Is this feature complete? Are there things that could be added in the future?
* Are there things that are intentionally left out?
* Do you know of a bug or corner case that does not work?
-->


## Checklist for review

Some things are not automated, and forgotten often. This list is a reminder for the reviewers.
* The bug fix is important enough to be backported? (label: 'backport requested')
* This PR touches english.txt or translations? Check the [guidelines](https://github.com/OpenTTD/OpenTTD/blob/master/docs/eints.md)
* This PR affects the save game format? (label 'savegame upgrade')
* This PR affects the GS/AI API? (label 'needs review: Script API')
    * ai_changelog.hpp, game_changelog.hpp need updating.
    * The compatibility wrappers (compat_*.nut) need updating.
* This PR affects the NewGRF API? (label 'needs review: NewGRF')
    * newgrf_debug_data.h may need updating.
    * [PR must be added to API tracker](https://wiki.openttd.org/en/Development/NewGRF/Specification%20Status)

pull_request.title: Fix d42a78f: Some raw drop down list strings may need token processing.
pull_request.body:
## Motivation / Problem

Some raw drop down list strings may need token processing. Storing the raw string without processing though GetString() caused token processing to be skipped.

<!--
Describe here shortly
* For bug fixes:
    * What problem does this solve?
    * If there is already an issue, link the issue, otherwise describe the problem here.
* For features or gameplay changes:
    * What was the motivation to develop this feature?
    * Does this address any problem with the gameplay or interface?
    * Which group of players do you think would enjoy this feature?
-->


## Description

This is resolved by preprocessing the raw string through `GetString()` when constructing the list item.

This fixes incorrect drop down list entries on the Story Book page selector.

<!--
Describe here shortly
* For bug fixes:
    * How is the problem solved?
* For features or gameplay changes:
    * What does this feature do?
    * How does it improve/solve the situation described under 'motivation'.
-->


## Limitations

<!--
Describe here
* Is the problem solved in all scenarios?
* Is this feature complete? Are there things that could be added in the future?
* Are there things that are intentionally left out?
* Do you know of a bug or corner case that does not work?
-->

    * [PR must be added to API tracker](https://wiki.openttd.org/en/Development/NewGRF/Specification%20Status)

commits.message:
Fix: [CI] Installed (and cached) vcpkg packages are never upgraded in release-linux workflow (#11396)

Other workflows use a per image cache because images provide a fixed vcpkg clone.

pull_request.title: Fix: [CI] Installed (and cached) vcpkg packages are never upgraded in release-linux workflow
pull_request.body:
## Motivation / Problem
Once installed (and cached) a vcpkg package will never be upgraded.
This is not an issue for most workflows as their cache is keyed on the runner image, and the vcpkg clone never changes inside an image.
But for `release-linux` it's a different story because we always clone the latest vcpkg repository, which may have package upgrades.
<!--
Describe here shortly
* For bug fixes:
    * What problem does this solve?
    * If there is already an issue, link the issue, otherwise describe the problem here.
* For features or gameplay changes:
    * What was the motivation to develop this feature?
    * Does this address any problem with the gameplay or interface?
    * Which group of players do you think would enjoy this feature?
-->


## Description
Force upgrade of already installed packages before installing new ones, but only for `release-linux` workflow.
<!--
Describe here shortly
* For bug fixes:
    * How is the problem solved?
* For features or gameplay changes:
    * What does this feature do?
    * How does it improve/solve the situation described under 'motivation'.
-->


## Limitations
Build might fail when vcpkg "breaks" a package (happens sometimes)
<!--
Describe here
* Is the problem solved in all scenarios?
* Is this feature complete? Are there things that could be added in the future?
* Are there things that are intentionally left out?
* Do you know of a bug or corner case that does not work?
-->


## Checklist for review

Some things are not automated, and forgotten often. This list is a reminder for the reviewers.
* The bug fix is important enough to be backported? (label: 'backport requested')
* This PR touches english.txt or translations? Check the [guidelines](https://github.com/OpenTTD/OpenTTD/blob/master/docs/eints.md)
* This PR affects the save game format? (label 'savegame upgrade')
* This PR affects the GS/AI API? (label 'needs review: Script API')
    * ai_changelog.hpp, game_changelog.hpp need updating.
    * The compatibility wrappers (compat_*.nut) need updating.
* This PR affects the NewGRF API? (label 'needs review: NewGRF')
    * newgrf_debug_data.h may need updating.
    * [PR must be added to API tracker](https://wiki.openttd.org/en/Development/NewGRF/Specification%20Status)

pull_request.title: Fix: Incorrect title on framerate windows for AIs.
pull_request.body:
## Motivation / Problem

Window caption for AI framerate graphs consumes multiple parameters, but the caption string is STR_JUST_STRING.
<!--
Describe here shortly
* For bug fixes:
    * What problem does this solve?
    * If there is already an issue, link the issue, otherwise describe the problem here.
* For features or gameplay changes:
    * What was the motivation to develop this feature?
    * Does this address any problem with the gameplay or interface?
    * Which group of players do you think would enjoy this feature?
-->


## Description

Replace with STR_JUST_STRING2.

<!--
Describe here shortly
* For bug fixes:
    * How is the problem solved?
* For features or gameplay changes:
    * What does this feature do?
    * How does it improve/solve the situation described under 'motivation'.
-->

pull_request.title: Fix: OpenTTD can fail to exit on an error due to mutex locks in threads.
pull_request.body:
## Motivation / Problem

The game can crash but fail to exit due to waiting on a mutex lock.

<!--
Describe here shortly
* For bug fixes:
    * What problem does this solve?
    * If there is already an issue, link the issue, otherwise describe the problem here.
* For features or gameplay changes:
    * What was the motivation to develop this feature?
    * Does this address any problem with the gameplay or interface?
    * Which group of players do you think would enjoy this feature?
-->


## Description

This could be fixed by ensuring that all resources are properly released... or we can just call `_exit()` instead `exit()`. This is already done in other places so shouldn't be too controversial...

<!--
Describe here shortly
* For bug fixes:
    * How is the problem solved?
* For features or gameplay changes:
    * What does this feature do?
    * How does it improve/solve the situation described under 'motivation'.
-->


## Limitations

<!--
Describe here
* Is the problem solved in all scenarios?
* Is this feature complete? Are there things that could be added in the future?
* Are there things that are intentionally left out?
* Do you know of a bug or corner case that does not work?
-->


## Checklist for review

Some things are not automated, and forgotten often. This list is a reminder for the reviewers.
* The bug fix is important enough to be backported? (label: 'backport requested')
* This PR touches english.txt or translations? Check the [guidelines](https://github.com/OpenTTD/OpenTTD/blob/master/docs/eints.md)
* This PR affects the save game format? (label 'savegame upgrade')
* This PR affects the GS/AI API? (label 'needs review: Script API')
    * ai_changelog.hpp, game_changelog.hpp need updating.
    * The compatibility wrappers (compat_*.nut) need updating.
* This PR affects the NewGRF API? (label 'needs review: NewGRF')
    * newgrf_debug_data.h may need updating.
    * [PR must be added to API tracker](https://wiki.openttd.org/en/Development/NewGRF/Specification%20Status)

pull_request.title: Fix: [CI] Installed (and cached) vcpkg packages are never upgraded in release-linux workflow
pull_request.body:
## Motivation / Problem
Once installed (and cached) a vcpkg package will never be upgraded.
This is not an issue for most workflows as their cache is keyed on the runner image, and the vcpkg clone never changes inside an image.
But for `release-linux` it's a different story because we always clone the latest vcpkg repository, which may have package upgrades.
<!--
Describe here shortly
* For bug fixes:
    * What problem does this solve?
    * If there is already an issue, link the issue, otherwise describe the problem here.
* For features or gameplay changes:
    * What was the motivation to develop this feature?
    * Does this address any problem with the gameplay or interface?
    * Which group of players do you think would enjoy this feature?
-->


## Description
Force upgrade of already installed packages before installing new ones, but only for `release-linux` workflow.
<!--
Describe here shortly
* For bug fixes:
    * How is the problem solved?
* For features or gameplay changes:
    * What does this feature do?
    * How does it improve/solve the situation described under 'motivation'.
-->


## Limitations
Build might fail when vcpkg "breaks" a package (happens sometimes)
<!--
Describe here
* Is the problem solved in all scenarios?
* Is this feature complete? Are there things that could be added in the future?
* Are there things that are intentionally left out?
* Do you know of a bug or corner case that does not work?
-->


## Checklist for review

Some things are not automated, and forgotten often. This list is a reminder for the reviewers.
* The bug fix is important enough to be backported? (label: 'backport requested')
* This PR touches english.txt or translations? Check the [guidelines](https://github.com/OpenTTD/OpenTTD/blob/master/docs/eints.md)
* This PR affects the save game format? (label 'savegame upgrade')
* This PR affects the GS/AI API? (label 'needs review: Script API')
    * ai_changelog.hpp, game_changelog.hpp need updating.
    * The compatibility wrappers (compat_*.nut) need updating.
* This PR affects the NewGRF API? (label 'needs review: NewGRF')
    * newgrf_debug_data.h may need updating.
    * [PR must be added to API tracker](https://wiki.openttd.org/en/Development/NewGRF/Specification%20Status)

comment.body:
Am I reading right that this makes any competitor vehicle that attempts to load finish its loading instantly?
My worry is a denial-of-service where a competitor blocks the helipad with a full load order that will (obviously) never complete.

Another potential DoS in the same category is making a vehicle wait at the helipad with a timetable minimum wait time.

pull_request.title: Fix #11392: Make neutral stations behave as industry-exclusivity company.
pull_request.body:
## Motivation / Problem

Industry exclusivity ignores neutral stations.

<!--
Describe here shortly
* For bug fixes:
    * What problem does this solve?
    * If there is already an issue, link the issue, otherwise describe the problem here.
* For features or gameplay changes:
    * What was the motivation to develop this feature?
    * Does this address any problem with the gameplay or interface?
    * Which group of players do you think would enjoy this feature?
-->


## Description

When testing station ownership for exclusivity, pretend a neutral station's owner is the same as its exclusivity consumer/supplier.

This means that goods can still be transfer between station and industry when exclusivity is setup, but this doesn't actually check who is consuming or supplying.

So we also check during (un)load that the vehicle owner matches the exclusivity company too.

<!--
Describe here shortly
* For bug fixes:
    * How is the problem solved?
* For features or gameplay changes:
    * What does this feature do?
    * How does it improve/solve the situation described under 'motivation'.
-->


## Limitations

This is NOT TESTED.

<!--
Describe here
* Is the problem solved in all scenarios?
* Is this feature complete? Are there things that could be added in the future?
* Are there things that are intentionally left out?
* Do you know of a bug or corner case that does not work?
-->


## Checklist for review

Some things are not automated, and forgotten often. This list is a reminder for the reviewers.
* The bug fix is important enough to be backported? (label: 'backport requested')
* This PR touches english.txt or translations? Check the [guidelines](https://github.com/OpenTTD/OpenTTD/blob/master/docs/eints.md)

    * ai_changelog.hpp, game_changelog.hpp need updating.

    * newgrf_debug_data.h may need updating.
    * [PR must be added to API tracker](https://wiki.openttd.org/en/Development/NewGRF/Specification%20Status)
